gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Interface ISparseArray3DList

All Superinterfaces:
IPointList3D, IVirtualArray
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPhysicalArray3DList
All Known Implementing Classes:
PhysicalArray3DList, SparseArray3DList
public interface ISparseArray3DList
extends IPointList3D

This interface is intended for classes that must store scattered three dimensional mappings of data that change through frames. The coordinates for each point are assumed to be static, and only the values at those points change with each frame. Thus for each 3d point, there is a list of data values with length equal to the number of frames. For each point that is in ISparseArray3DList, there is an associated integer index. The range of this index runs from zero to the total number of points, which should be provided to the constructor. If no positions are given at construction, the points are intitalized as Vector3D objects with Float.NaN for the x, y, and z fields. For each frame, there is an associated integer index (frame index). The range of this index runs from zero to the number of frame steps currently in the array. The number of frames and their values should be set in the constructor. For each point and frame, a value may be set. The data value is intialized to Float.NaN. Also, methods exist to get slices of data values for either one time frame or one point. In addition to data values, the user can set associated error values to each piece of data. The values are initialized to Float.NaN whenever a point is added. For quick error setting, square root error approximation may be used.

Method Detail

getNumFrames

int getNumFrames()
Returns the number of frames. Frames are ordered by increasing value and each frame has an associated frame index integer. All frame indices share the same 3d points but may have different data values.

Returns:
This returns the number of points in the array.

set

void set(int point_index,
         Vector3D point,
         float[] values)
Set values at given point for all frame indices. The errors over all frames are set to Float.NaN

Parameters:
point_index - The index of point in array.
point - The 3d coordinates of the point.
values - Values for point for each frame index.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given values array is smaller than number of frames.

setValue

void setValue(int point_index,
              int frame_index,
              float value)
Set value for a single array element at given point and frame.

Parameters:
point_index - Point Index of the element.
frame_index - Frame Index of the element.
value - Value that element will be set to.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either index is outside of its respective valid range.

setValues

void setValues(int point_index,
               float[] values)
Sets values for every frame at given point.

Parameters:
point_index - Index to point that value be set for.
values - Array of float values
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index range goes outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given values array is smaller than specified range.

getValue

float getValue(int point_index,
               int frame_index)
Get value for a single array element based on point and frame indices.

Parameters:
point_index - Index of point for element.
frame_index - Index of frame for element.
Returns:
If element is found, the float value for that element is returned. If element is not found, Float.NaN is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().

setErrors

boolean setErrors(float[][] error_values)
Set the error values that correspond to the data. The size of error array should match the size of the data array. ZFloat.NaN will be left for undersized error arrays.s Values that are in an array that exceeds the data array will be ignored.

Parameters:
error_values - The array of error values corresponding to the data.
Returns:
True if error array succesfully matched size of data array.

getErrors

float[][] getErrors()
Get the error values corresponding to the data. If no error values have been set, the square-root of the data value will be returned.

Returns:
Copy of error values for the data.

setSquareRootErrors

void setSquareRootErrors(boolean use_sqrt)
Use this method to specify whether to use error values that were passed into the setErrors() method or to use the square-root of the data value.

Parameters:
use_sqrt - If true, use square-root. If false, use set error values if they exist.

getErrorValue

float getErrorValue(int point_index,
                    int frame_index)
Get an error value for given index. Returns Float.NaN if index is invalid.

Parameters:
point_index - Point index corresponding to data.
frame_index - Frame index corresponding to data.
Returns:
Error value for data at specified index. If invalid, Float.NaN is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().
